New Records: Freddie Freeman became the first player to homer in the first four games of a World Series.
Freddie Freeman's streak of long balls in six straight games is one more than Houston’s George Springer in 2017 and 2019.
Anthony Volpe became the first player in Series history with a grand slam and a pair of stolen bases in one game.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's third-inning grand slam sparked the Yankees to an 11-4 win.
Freddie Freeman hit a first-inning home run.
Austin Wells and Gleyber Torres added homers for the Yankees.
Will Smith hit a homer for the Dodgers.
Yankees' bullpen strung together five innings of one-hit scoreless relief with seven strikeouts.
Aaron Judge drove in his first run of the Series with an RBI single in the eighth.
Shohei Ohtani went 1 for 4 with a single, his first hit since partially separating his left shoulder in Game 2.
Pre-Game Insights: Game 5 is Wednesday night, with the Yankees ace Gerrit Cole and the Dodgers’ Jack Flaherty meeting in a rematch of Game 1.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed excitement after his first World Series win as New York's manager.
Freddie Freeman reflected on his home run streak and hoped to continue it in the next game.
Anthony Volpe shared his excitement about his performance and the dream of winning the World Series.
Austin Wells described the team's mood as relieved and ready to have fun.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New York avoided what would have been their first losing Series sweep since 1976.
The Yankees stopped a seven-game Series losing streak against the Dodgers dating to 1981.
The Yankees got their first seven RBI from the bottom three hitters in their batting order, Volpe, Wells, and Verdugo.
